action:
quickly open a file by typing its name
- Then type > to switch the search to the Command Palette (same as Ctrl+Shift+P)
- Then type # to search for a symbol across the entire workspace
- Then type @ to search for a symbol within the current file
navigate to the previous / next tab in the editor group
open next / previous editor in history
go to the specific editor tab number (1st, 2nd, etc.)
open Markdown preview to the side
undo and redo your changes! You can go back and forth between them infinitely - it's like a time machine for your code!
show the Command Palette and type 'auto save' to turn on automatic saving - never lose your work again!
show the Command Palette and type 'color theme' to change your editor's appearance
show the Command Palette and type 'format document' to clean up your code
show the Command Palette and type 'toggle terminal' to show/hide the terminal
show the Command Palette and type 'file icon theme' to change folder/file icons
show the Command Palette and type 'reload window' to restart VS Code quickly
open Settings to customize VS Code
show/hide the left sidebar (where you see your files)
open Debug view (to run and test your code step-by-step)
open Explorer view (to see your project files and folders)
open Search view (to find text across all files)
open Source Control view (to manage Git changes)
open Find and Replace across all files
open Problems view (to see errors and warnings in your code)
open Output view (to see logs and messages from extensions)
open Extensions view (to install and manage extensions)
insert cursor at the clicked position
select all occurrences of the Find match
copy the entire line when no text is selected
add selection to next Find match
select all occurrences of current word
move last selection to next Find match
select all occurrences of current selection
go to next / previous error or warning
insert cursor at end of each line selected
copy the absolute path of active file
copy the relative path of active file
move the current line or selected lines up/down
insert a new line below the current cursor position
cut the entire line when no text is selected
copy the current line or selected lines up/down
